Articles.Content:
I have tried aligning planes and orbit with another craft, however, im always to wrong spot, usually like 200/300 Km away from the orbitting craft.

Its seriously hard that way and i must be doing it wrong!

Does anybody know a fuel efficient way to rendevouz with a spacecraft?

Hi Dr,Poo you could take a look at this thread.

And look up Kosmo-Nots threads on rendezvous as well

What I do is put myself in a higher or lower orbit and let the difference in orbital speeds close the gap between myself and the craft I wish to rendezvous with, and then when I am closer I match its orbit, then thrust towards it, watching as it moves relative to me, if it drifts left, I thrust left.

Take it slow and you will get there, the worst thing you can do is rush
A MechJeb helps you know where you are and stabilize your ship, but it's pretty much impossible without a little bit of math as explained in the thread linked to by sal_vager.

Nah, you can wing it.

Take a ship with lots of fuel and RCS. Get into a lower orbit. Guess when to make the burn based on experience. Aim to land too far behind as apposed to being in front. Make sure your ap is lower than the target orbit. Circularise your orbit (you should be going slightly faster. Point your ship towards the others purple marker. I then use that and its position within my engine bell and use the RCS to keep it still while using its distance to guess at speed.

Also, I miscalculated on the fuel...
